sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A bosome opened to the Jewes holding forth to others some reasons for our receiving them into our nation. Tomlinson, William.
1 sheet ([1] p.)
Printed for Giles Calvert, at the Black-spread-Eagle at the west end of Pauls, London : 1656.
Signed at end: W. Tomlinson. Annotation on Thomason copy: "January 12 1655"; the 6 in the date has been crossed out and replaced with a 5. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
